text: one year ago in Rome the world got its
first look at its new pope and he
certainly changed the image of the
pontiff he's worn a fire helmet he's
held the lamb he takes selfies and of
course he takes to the Twitterverse but
what do people make of all this a Pew
Research Center survey of Americans
found that almost three-quarters of
Catholics think he represents a major
change more than half of non Catholics
think the same most Catholics in the
u.s. like the way things are going
overall but only a slim majority think
Pope Francis is doing a good job
addressing sexual abuse in the church
and that was one of their top priorities
for the pontiff a year ago meanwhile Pew
Research also found some interesting
stuff on Twitter see they analyzed
tweets about both Pope Francis and Pope
Benedict when he was still pontiff 84%
of Francis tweets were positive compared
to only 30% of benedict tweets Francis
clearly has made an impression even
getting comparisons to Superman but it's
not always positive for the pontiff his
critiques of capitalism have left many
conservatives fuming some wonder if
Francis is treated too much like a
celebrity which also brings us to the
so-called Francis effect the idea that
this popular Pope has attracted more
people to the Catholic Church Pew
Research found there isn't really any
evidence of this among Americans however
a quarter of people already in the
church say they've become more excited
by their faith in the past year
David Botti BBC News Washington
